meanings.definition: Capable of being done without; not necessary.
meanings.sent1: Carrying an umbrella on a sunny day is dispensable.
meanings.sent2: Having extra toppings on the pizza is dispensable.
meanings.sent3: Wearing a winter coat in the desert would be dispensable.
meanings.sent4: His role in the play was dispensable, easily filled by another actor.
meanings.sent5: The extra buttons on the remote control are dispensable and confusing.

meanings.definition: Able to be replaced or removed.
meanings.sent1: The batteries in the toy are dispensable and can be swapped out.
meanings.sent2: The old light bulbs are dispensable and can be changed for energy-efficient ones.
meanings.sent3: His argument was dispensable, easily substituted with a more convincing one.
meanings.sent4: The disposable cups are dispensable after one use, ready to be thrown away.
meanings.sent5: The removable cover on the phone is dispensable, allowing for customization.
